text: hi welcome to my cupcake addiction's
ballerina tutu cupcake tutorial I'm
gonna be showing you how to make these
gorgeous little ballet themed cupcakes
today I'm teaming up with my two
beautiful nieces Charlie and Ashley over
at the channel charli's crafty kitchen
which I will link to in the description
box below they'll be showing you how to
make these super simple new baked
ballerina marshmallow pops if you're
having a ballerina party you can also
check out my ballerina Barbie cake which
I will also link to in the description
box below the things that you'll need
today I've got just the inside of a roll
of wrapping paper or tubing and I just
cut that in half let's get it create a
bit of a forma to form the shape of our
ballerina tutu Boris's today I'm using a
fondant rolling pin and a paintbrush and
I've also got a little bit of cornflour
in a shaker I've got some fondant in
yellow pink and purple and I will
mention that I've added a little bit of
Thai Lowe's or CMC powder to help that
fondant set nice and firm nice and
quickly over here I've got some tap
water some edible sugar pearls and some
little edible silver balls
I've got a little bit of our perfectly
pipeable buttercream frosting I've just
tinted that pink and I will link to that
recipe in the description box below I've
got that frosting tonight in a
disposable piping bag and I've teamed up
with the Wilton number 406 petal piping
tip you can see the tip there you can
use any size petal tip you like I've got
a love heart cutter I've also got a
really small flower cutter this is a
little bit optional just for one of our
bodice details my cupcakes ready to
frost and I've also got this piece of
lace so this is just a piece of new and
clean lace fabric and it's got quite a
thick textured lace on the front we're
going to be using that just to give our
Boris's a little bit of extra detail
today so let's get started the first
thing you want to do is you want to roll
out your fondant so I'm not rolling that
too thin and I've put down a bit of
cornflour just so my fondant doesn't
stick to the bench about two millimeters
is great roll out all three of your
colours and then we're going to give
them a bit of a lacy imprint I'm taking
that lace and I'm going to put it with
sort of the fatter textured side facing
into the fondant and the finer side
facing out and I'm just picking a nice
part of the pattern laying it over the
fondant and using quite a bit of
pressure give it once
roll just in one direction that's going
to imprint that pattern and it's also
going to flatten that fondant out a
little bit more which is why we start
with it a little bit thicker repeat that
for your other two colors and then you
want to take your love heart cutter now
this is quite long at the base you want
to make sure you've got enough room that
the love hearts got enough of a point on
the end of it to stick down into your
cupcake when it's dried so a longer love
heart cutter is better once you've cut
your love hearts take the yellow fondant
and roll it quite thin before taking
your little flower plunge cutter and you
just want to cut out a flower plunge the
cutter and pop it out like I said
optional just for a little bit of bodice
detailing because every ballerina is
unique I'm going to show you how to make
not one but three gorgeous tutu designs
today we're going to start off with the
simplest of the three which is the pink
so take a tiny bit of water apply it to
the back of your little yellow flower
and just stick the center of the flower
down right up in the top corner another
little dot of water on the top center of
the flower and you can pop a sugar pearl
in and as you push that pearl down it
actually brings up those petals and
makes it look a little bit
three-dimensional kind of popping up off
the bodice take it and lay it over that
half wrapping paper roll and that's
going to give you that really nice shape
when it dries for your second one which
is our purple I just painted with water
a little shape of a necklace straight
onto that fondant and then there's
little soft sugar pearls I just pressed
in so push them all on sort of gently to
begin with until you're happy with the
positioning you can make sure they're
all going to fit and then give them a
good push down so they're really well
stuck before laying them over that
little former
fear yellow one paint like a large
circle of water and then put down one of
your silver edible balls in the center
and you want to surround it with those
little white sugar pearls this is
actually my favorite I think it kind of
looks like a little vintage brooch or
something but I think it's very pretty
and very girly once again you want to
give that a good push down with your
fingers to make sure they're really well
stuck and pop it over your little former
you need to let those dry for at least
24 hours if you have the talos or CMC
and at least three days if you don't
here's some we prepared earlier so you
want to take your piping bag now and you
need to make sure that the skinny point
of that tip is facing back towards your
body now picking up your cupcake you can
see how I'm ruffling it I'm really just
giving it tiny little movements with my
wrist and I'm letting that frosting sort
of fall out of the piping tip as I'm
moving it in a backward and forward
motion I'm going all the way out over
the edge of that cupcakes I'm kind of
covering the cupcake case a little bit
and to keep things neat try to start and
finish at the same point for all three
of your layers so if your second layer
it's exactly the same technique just
those tiny little movements back and
forward letting that frosting fall out
in those beautiful little ribbons but
you're actually bringing that layer down
about halfway across the layer below it
and the same for that top layer so
you're giving that layered effect of
that beautiful ruffled too to finish
that off and make sure that you can't
see any of that cupcake poking out even
if you need to pop a little tiny dot
more in and then you want to take your
little bodice with the bodice you need
to make sure the bottom point of this
heart goes into the actual cupcake not
just into the frosting so I can feel
cake here and then I push it down about
another half a centimetre don't go too
low because you don't want her to have a
big thick bodice you do want it to be
quite fine but you need it to go into
the cake repeat that technique with some
pale yellow and some pale purple
frosting or whatever colors you like
this is a relatively simple technique
but if you haven't done it before
I do recommend just practicing on a
little plate or on a little dish just
until you get the hang of it it's really
quite simple but it does take a little
bit of practice in goes that second
bodice that will repeat that with the
purple and there you've got your three
beautiful little ballerina tutu cupcakes
for treats your little ballerina can
also help you make make sure you check
out charli's crafty kitchen which I'll
link to in the description box below and
I'll also leave a link to that ballerina
Barbie cake to complete your ballerina
party as always thanks so much for
watching
